author: Whitney Burney,Matt Dale
title: Drivers battle nasty morning commute as snowstorm blows through
text: After a snowstorm blew through metro Detroit Friday morning, drivers were forced to deal with slick roads, heavy snow and low visibility. "This is some real bipolar weather. I don’t know if it’s the Aries coming in or the Pisces leaving. I don’t know which it is for real," said as he stopped for gas in Southfield. Friday morning, around 30 crashes were reported on metro Detroit freeways. "I didn’t think we’d get that much (snow) here either. I don’t know where it came from, but I wish it would go back," driver Paul Ayott said after getting on the roads in Macomb County around 8 a.m. Friday. "For a while, 50 feet, you couldn’t see because it was snowing that powdery little snow. It was no (salt) trucks out. I didn’t see a truck until about 9:30 (in the morning). That’s not to say they weren’t out, they just weren’t out where I was." Several drivers echoes the same concerns of a lack of salt trucks on the roads to 7 Action News crews. "Do you guys feel like the magnitude of this storm caught you off guard at all," 7 Action News reporter Whitney Burney asked. "No, we expected (this). We had forecasts from the National Weather Service, our forecasting services, your meteorologists, so we knew it was going to come. We knew it was going to come hard," Bryson says they put the all-hands-on-deck call out for drivers around 3 a.m. and got all 109 of their trucks out by 5 a.m. "It actually worked out fairly well this morning," Bryson said. "We got them in just before the snow started and they were able to get on the road as the snow was falling. That’s ideal. Unfortunately, when the snow falls very hard and rush hour is picking up and we have bumper to bumper traffic, that makes it very difficult." The Macomb County Department of Roads says they ran into the same issue. "We try and prep as best as possible. We can’t get out too early. So, it just depends when the snowfalls, the duration of the snowfall, if it’s a mixture of freezing rain, freezing temperatures," said Bryan Santo, who is the director of the Macomb County Road Department. Santo says their team had all 60 salt trucks working to clear primary roads for much of the day. "I think our crews were called in around 6 or 7 o'clock to start on the route as far as our salting and plowing of the roadways. We got an early start. We’ll keep our crews over into the evening as long as the duration of the storm continues," Santo said. Both Macomb and Oakland counties say they're anticipating being on the roads overnight and possibly into the weekend as more snow is expected Friday evening.

author: Team Asianet Newsable
title: Printed petals adorn Ayodhya's Ram Temple: Florist's visionary tribute takes center stage
text:
Printed petals adorn Ayodhya's Ram Temple: Florist's visionary tribute takes center stage Preparations are in full swing for the seven-day mega ceremony, commencing on January 16. Artisans from diverse corners of India are diligently crafting floral masterpieces at Ram Katha Park. These designs draw inspiration from the revered Lord Ram, his iconic bow and arrow, Lord Hanuman, and sacred tilak motifs.
Team Asianet Newsable First Published Dec 29, 2023, 12:58 PM IST Follow Ahead of the inauguration of revered Ram Temple in Ayodhya, vibrant offerings from across India is set to embellish the sacred grounds. Among these extraordinary tributes are a towering 108-foot incense stick, a majestic gold bow and arrow, and an impressive 2,100kg bell crafted from a fusion of eight metals, all destined for the temple precincts.
Adding a touch of floral finesse to this grandeur, a Gujarat-based florist, Ashok Bansali, is orchestrating a distinct floral adornment for the temple complex. These flowers, intricately designed with Ram Lalla's name and the invocation "Jai Shri Ram," will be delicately positioned near the deity's idol.
JD(U) national executive meeting commences amid denial of leadership alterations; check details
Bansali's innovative journey involves four years of dedicated effort to develop technology that prints words and images onto delicate flower petals. With pride, he displays a collection of pink roses bearing the images of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, alongside inscriptions such as "Ram Lalla" and "Atmanirbhar Bharat."
Driven by the ethos of the 'Make in India' initiative, Bansali handprinted each petal, investing considerable time in the process. His visionary approach extends beyond flowers; he plans to imprint similar images on indoor plant leaves designated for the temple complex.
During the groundbreaking ceremony in 2020, Bansali presented 500 floral creations. This time, with a larger vision, he aspires to produce between 3,000 to 4,000 adorned flowers for the veneration of Lord Ram.
'Barcodes for change': Congress unveils innovative crowdfunding strategy at 'Hain Taiyyar Hum' rally in Nagpur
Preparations are in full swing for the seven-day mega ceremony, commencing on January 16. Artisans from diverse corners of India are diligently crafting floral masterpieces at Ram Katha Park. These designs draw inspiration from the revered Lord Ram, his iconic bow and arrow, Lord Hanuman, and sacred tilak motifs.
The auspicious ceremony on January 22 will witness the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, marking a historic milestone in this much-anticipated event. His address to devotees at the temple's main entrance will encapsulate the sanctity and grandeur of this significant occasion.

author: Last-On-Your-Lips
title: Drastic Dramatic
text:
-
dreamy take that, Vance, you nasty little convert panting after the tradcaths. it’s hard to fuck up converting to Catholicism so bad that you wind up being specifically admonished by the Pope.
the actual letter itself is also well worth reading and pulls no punches for a Catholic audience; it’s the kind of reading someone for filth you can only pull off from someone who knows you very well and shares a lot of theoretical values with you. on a theological level, invoking the thirty days of wandering lost in the desert, Jesus as a god-become-man, and Joseph-Mary-and-Jesus in Nazareth as refugees are all extremely powerful metaphors within context; so is invoking the story of the Good Samaritan as the source of the central insight in the fullest maturity of humankind.
Then he ends by speaking to three groups. The first is American Catholic bishops, who he very pointedly praises for the efforts to support immigrants and refugees they are most assuredly making, for which God will of course reward them. (The American bishopric as a whole is a particularly conservative faction among international Catholicism and in fact most recently had a scandal when the second Catholic US president ever was elected in 2020 and a bunch of them threw fits at the idea of congratulating the new President on account of it was Biden; the Pope, by contrast, is a Jesuit out of Argentina whose parents fled Mussolini, and he is not into that shit.)
The second group he addresses is American lay Catholics and “all men and women of good will, not to give in to narratives that discriminate against and cause unnecessary suffering to our migrant and refugee brothers and sisters.” He’s just taken some time to extremely clearly demand that the lay faithful “consider the legitimacy of norms and public policies in the light of the dignity of the person and his or her fundamental rights, not vice versa,” and otherwise strongly imply that unjust laws should be opposed by as many of the citizenry as possible. In that light, he’s juuuuuuuuuuuust one level of plausible deniability away from calling for all Catholics to oppose this administration, root and stem, as a grave matter of high-stakes faith.
Then he ends by invoking Mary to protect all refugees and immigrants worldwide, just to really grind it in where his concern lies and what he thinks people of good conscience should do. it’s written very strongly and very sharply. deeply satisfying to read, thank you, and about what you’d expect from the first pope ever to name himself for St Francis of Assisi.
-

author: Valerio Papadia
title: Ancora maltempo a Napoli e in Campania: allerta meteo prorogata anche sabato 14 dicembre
text:
Ancora maltempo a Napoli e in Campania: allerta meteo prorogata anche sabato 14 dicembre
Valerio Papadia
Prosegue l'ondata di maltempo che sta interessando Napoli e la Campania: l'allerta meteo di colore giallo, inizialmente prevista fino alle ore 9, è stata prorogata per tutta la giornata di sabato 14 dicembre, fino alla prima mattinata di domenica 15. Sono previste precipitazioni intense, anche a carattere di temporali, sulle seguenti zone della Campania: 1 (Piana Campana, Napoli, Isole, Area Vesuviana); 2 (Alto Volturno e Matese); 3 (Penisola Sorrentino-Amalfitana, Monti di Sarno e Monti Picentini); 5 (Tusciano e Alto Sele); 6 (Piana del Sele e Alto Cilento); 8 (Basso Cilento).
La Protezione Civile della Campania ricorda che, vista l'allerta gialla per rischio idrogeologico, gli agenti atmosferici previsti potrebbero provocare anche i seguenti fenomeni: allagamenti, esondazioni, innalzamento dei livelli idrometrici dei corsi d'acqua, caduta massi e frane, in considerazione della fragilità dei territori.
Infine, la Protezione Civile raccomanda i sindaci di attivare i COC (Centri Operativi Comunali) e di attuare tutte le misure adeguate a prevenire, mitigare e contrastare i fenomeni meteorologici previsti. A Napoli, in virtù dell'allerta meteo, il Comune ha deciso di tenere chiusi i parchi e le spiagge comunali, nonché l'Arenile di Bagnoli.

author: Redazione Anci
title: Anci aderisce a campagna Parlamento europeo e invita i Comuni a illuminare di blu un luogo simbolo
text:
- Aprile 18, 2024
Europee
Anci aderisce a campagna Parlamento europeo e invita i Comuni a illuminare di blu un luogo simboloLa campagna, promossa in collaborazione con la Commissione europea e con l’Associazione Civita, in occasione delle prossime elezioni europee che si terranno l'8 e il 9 giugno, punta ad accrescere la consapevolezza sul voto europeo. I Comuni possono aderire illuminando con il colore blu della bandiera europea alcuni luoghi simbolo della città. Le foto potranno essere inviate all'indirizzo email: epitalia@ep.europa.eu
L’Anci aderisce alla
campagna istituzionale promossa dal Parlamento europeo in occasione delle prossime elezioni europee che si terranno l’8 e il 9 giugno. La campagna, che punta ad accrescere la consapevolezza sul voto europeo, sarà lanciata ufficialmente il prossimo 9 maggio, in occasione della Festa dell’Europa, ad un mese dalle elezioni. Il tema principale di questa campagna, promossa in collaborazione con la Commissione europea e con l’Associazione Civita, sarà quello di illuminare con il colore blu della bandiera europea alcuni luoghi simbolo della nostra comune identità civica, storica e culturale, come piazze, municipi, o altri monumenti iconici delle città italiane come simbolo delle nostre comuni radici e valori europei. Le immagini dei monumenti illuminati il 9 maggio e/o alcuni giorni prima delle elezioni dell’8 e 9 giugno, saranno promosse tramite campagna media e social media.
L’Anci invita i Comuni a partecipare. Le foto del luogo illuminato di blu potranno essere inviate all’indirizzo email: epitalia@ep.europa.eu.

author: Michał Rogucki
title: Turkey Bolsters Defense with Cutting-Edge Anka-3 Stealth Drone
text:
Turkey Bolsters Defense with Cutting-Edge Anka-3 Stealth Drone
Summary: Türkiye advances its aerial warfare capabilities with the successful test flight of the new Anka-3 unmanned aerial vehicle, a stealth drone designed to enhance reconnaissance and combat operations with a suite of sophisticated weaponry and technology.
Turkey is taking a significant leap in strengthening its defense strategy with the introduction of the Anka-3 drone, an advanced unmanned combat aerial vehicle developed by the nation’s aerospace mainstay, Turkish Aerospace Industries. The Turkish President celebrated the inaugural flight of this stealth drone through a social media post on December 28, where he emphasized the high-tech features and broad potential the Anka-3 offers to Turkey’s defense system.
Designed to seamlessly blend with the clouds, the Anka-3 achieved a pivotal milestone by soaring through the skies, clocking in at a speed of 150 knots, and performing intricate maneuvers such as a runway overshoot test during its first deployment that exhibited its operational readiness and agility. Endowed with a suite of capabilities to conduct long-duration reconnaissance and precision strikes, this flying-wing UAV is set to revolutionize modern warfare for the country.
Capable of ascending to 40,000 feet and maintaining tenacious flight endurance, the Anka-3 ups the game with a robust payload capacity, allowing it to be equipped with a diverse array of air-to-ground and air-to-air armaments, surveillance apparatus and formidable radar technology. From universally implemented UAV munitions to high-caliber ordnance, the Anka-3 signifies Türkiye’s onward march towards self-reliance and strategic dominance in defense technology.
FAQ Section:
What is the Anka-3 unmanned aerial vehicle?
– The Anka-3 is Turkey’s new advanced unmanned combat aerial vehicle, designed for reconnaissance and combat operations. It enhances aerial warfare capabilities with stealth features and sophisticated weaponry.
Who developed the Anka-3 drone?
– The Anka-3 drone was developed by Turkish Aerospace Industries, which is a major aerospace company in Turkey.
What are the capabilities of the Anka-3?
– The Anka-3 is capable of flying at altitudes up to 40,000 feet, speeds of 150 knots, and can perform long-duration reconnaissance and precision strikes. It is equipped with various air-to-ground and air-to-air weapons, surveillance systems, and advanced radar technology.
How does the Anka-3 enhance Turkey’s defense system?
– The Anka-3 enhances Turkey’s defense by providing advanced technology for stealthy, high-altitude reconnaissance and combat operations, allowing for greater self-reliance and strategic defense capability.
What are some unique features of the Anka-3?
– The Anka-3 features a flying-wing design to blend in with the clouds for stealth operations and is capable of intricate maneuvers. Its robust payload capacity allows it to be fitted with a wide range of armaments and surveillance equipment.
Definitions:
– Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV): An aircraft without a human pilot onboard, controlled remotely or autonomously.
– Stealth Technology: Design strategies used in military aircraft to avoid detection by radar and other sensors.
– Payload Capacity: The carrying capacity of an aircraft, including passengers, cargo, and equipment.
– Reconnaissance: Military observation of a region to locate an enemy or ascertain strategic features.
– Precision Strike: The ability to accurately target and destroy enemy positions with minimal collateral damage.
Related Links:
Turkish Aerospace Industries
Michał Rogucki is a pioneering figure in the field of renewable energy, particularly known for his work on solar power innovations. His research and development efforts have significantly advanced solar panel efficiency and sustainability. Rogucki’s commitment to green energy solutions is also evident in his advocacy for integrating renewable sources into national power grids. His groundbreaking work not only contributes to the scientific community but also plays a crucial role in promoting environmental sustainability and energy independence. Rogucki’s influence extends beyond academia, impacting industry practices and public policy regarding renewable energy.

author: Lissette Gonzalez
title: Cool, comfortable start across South Florida, afternoon warms to the upper 70s - CBS Miami
text:
MIAMI - A comfortably cool start to Thursday with temperatures mostly in the low to mid-60s across Broward and Miami-Dade , a few inland areas saw the upper 50s. It was milder in the Keys with the low 70s. Some areas were five to 10 degrees warmer than Wednesday.
Afternoon highs will be warmer with the upper 70s. A few showers will be possible due to a weak front moving through. This front will not have a lot of moisture so the rain chance is low.
Friday we'll enjoy a cooler start with low 60s and highs will be seasonable in the upper 70s with mainly dry conditions.
This weekend will be warmer with lows near 70 degrees and highs around 80 degrees. Saturday will turn windy with the potential for scattered showers and storms. We remain unsettled on Sunday with the chance for some showers and storms. Early next week the rain chance decreases but we stay warm with spotty showers possible.
More from CBS News After chilly start, warming trend begins Wednesday afternoon Chilly start to 2024, plenty of sun in the afternoon After chilly start, a gorgeous afternoon with highs in the low 70s Sunrise police officer, attempted murder suspect injured in Fort Lauderdale shooting Family of beaten, mentally ill Broward Jail inmate seeks answers after deadly jail attack In: Fort Lauderdale Miami Lissette Gonzalez Lissette Gonzalez has served as the morning and noon meteorologist for CBS4 News since 2007. Viewers can watch Lissette's weathercasts weekday mornings from 5 to 9 a.m. and again at noon.

author: Nasiru Eneji Abdulrasheed
title: Philippines Mobilizes 1 Million Farmers to Combat El Niño and Transform Agriculture
text:
In an ambitious move to combat the effects of the El Niño phenomenon and fulfill a presidential directive, the Department of Agriculture in the Philippines has mobilized an army of over 1 million farmers, introducing them to water-saving technology. This initiative, part of President Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr.'s broader agenda to bolster the agricultural sector, leverages innovative strategies like Alternate Wetting and Drying (AWD) and Quick Turnaround (QTA) to mitigate the impact of climate variability on farming. With replanting efforts already underway across more than 5,500 hectares of rice farms, the government's proactive stance signals a transformative period for Philippine agriculture amid environmental challenges.
Empowering Farmers through Task Force El Niño
In response to the looming threat of El Niño, the Philippine government has launched Task Force El Niño, a comprehensive aid program aimed at equipping 4,000 affected farmers with the tools and resources needed to weather the phenomenon. This includes the distribution of seeds for alternative crops more resilient to dry conditions and the repair of vital irrigation canals. The initiative not only underscores the government's commitment to sustainable farming practices but also reflects a strategic shift towards ensuring food security and farmer welfare in the face of climatic adversities.
Revolutionizing Agriculture with F2C2
Amid budgetary adjustments, President Marcos Jr.'s visionary Farm and Fisheries Clustering and Consolidation (F2C2) initiative has made significant strides in transforming the landscape of Philippine agriculture. With a focus on accelerating the consolidation of small farms to achieve economies of scale, the F2C2 program has successfully catalyzed the formation of 711 new empowered clusters, benefitting 484,396 farmers and fisherfolk across various agricultural sectors. This strategic move, inspired by successful models from neighboring countries like Taiwan, aims to enhance productivity, efficiency, and competitiveness in the agricultural sector through collaboration and innovation.
A Blueprint for Agricultural Advancement
The Philippine government has outlined a comprehensive strategy to jumpstart the development of the agricultural sector. Key initiatives include the promotion of farm clustering, the establishment of a farmers and fishery registry, and the integration of satellite imaging and digital technology to improve farming practices. By shifting the focus from traditional crops like rice to a more diversified crop portfolio and engaging the private sector in agricultural development, the government aims to foster a more resilient, efficient, and scientifically-driven agricultural sector. These efforts, underscored by an emphasis on efficient resource use and private sector participation, herald a new era of growth and prosperity for Philippine agriculture.
In a testament to his commitment to the welfare of farmers, President Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr. has championed various government programs aimed at enhancing their yield and income. Recognizing the vital role of agriculture in the nation's economy and the hard work of its farmers, the President's initiatives reflect a profound dedication to supporting and transforming the agricultural sector. As these programs begin to take root, the future of Philippine agriculture looks promising, with the potential for increased productivity, sustainability, and economic upliftment for farmers nationwide.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Mystery over 19-year-old’s last moments after his naked body was found on the road following four-day party
text:
By Dan Gooding ,
1 hour ago
A newly-graduated teenager who vanished from a four-day party had a fractured skull, broken ribs and his teeth were scattered around him when he was found naked and dead on the side of a rural highway in Oklahoma.
Mystery surrounds the final moments of Noah Presgrove, 19, who told friends he was leaving the party to go for a walk. His body was found about a mile away on the side of US 81 in Jefferson County, Oklahoma on Labor Day, 2023.
Oklahoma Highway Patrol described Presgrove’s death as “suspicious” in mid-September but now, seven months later, with the investigation into his death seemingly gone quiet, his family are speaking out and revealing the harrowing nature of his injuries.
Presgrove, described as goofy, fearless and hilarious by family, had recently graduated from Comanche High School and was enjoying a summer off before he planned to join the military.
He’d been at a four-day 22nd birthday party when, friends say, he decided to go for a walk but couldn’t find one of his shoes so he took another instead.
What happened after remains a mystery.
Presgrove’s family say they have not been allowed to see the Medical Examiner’s report outlining his cause fo death.
When he was found, he was naked except for a pair of mismatched shoes.
His aunt Robyn Smith told NewsNation: “There was a wound to the back of his head, different skull fractures. He had ribs broken, and it was all on the left side,” earlier this week.
Noah’s teeth were found scattered on the ground, she said, while he had rashes from road gravel on his shoulder and hip.
Ms Smith said her nephew’s body was severely bruised and swollen when the family saw it at the funeral home, with his fingertips appearing to be “shredded”.
“They said that they didn’t think that this was from a vehicle,” Ms Smith told the outlet. “There was no indication of any kind of injuries to the lower half of his body.”
Cousins who spoke to KFOR described Noah as “fearless”, “goofy”, and “hilarious”.
“At the end of the day, what we know is that he lost his life,” cousin Lindsay Fowler told KFOR .
“He was found on the side of the highway. And it appears that he was dumped there and someone knows what happened. And we want to know what happened.”
Relatives feel that instead of answers, the OHP has left them in the dark.
Many of Noah’s cousins, aunts and grandparents have been active on a Facebook page called “Justice for Noah Presgrave”, seeking to raise awareness of his case and pressure authorities for answers.
A spokesperson for the OHP would only tell The Independent that “the investigation is still ongoing”, while the OSBI deferred to the OHP.
